nodes.speaker: navigator_chen
nodes.text: Captain, I've got a drifting probe on sensors. Old Federation design. Solar panels are cracked, but the primary data dish seems intact.

choices.text: [Reconnaissance] "Kim, give it a full-spectrum scan before we get any closer."
"No time to waste. Chen, take us in close for salvage."
Ignore it. We have bigger problems.
[Previous Loop] "That's not a probe, it's a black box. The data core is what matters, but it's rigged to wipe."

nodes.speaker: science_officer_kim
nodes.text: Scan complete. The power signature is strange... there's a secondary power source I can't identify, and the data core is shielded with military-grade encryption. This is more than a simple weather probe.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: We are in position. What are your orders for the salvage operation?

choices.text: [Engineering] "Carefully extract the fuel cells. Avoid the data core."
[Computer Science] "Hack the data core. I want to know what it's hiding."
[Second Thoughts] "This feels wrong. Pull back. We're leaving it."

nodes.speaker: science_officer_kim
nodes.text: Rigged to wipe? Let me see... yes, I see it. A logic bomb tied to any unauthorized access attempt. But if I create a recursive loop in the access query... I can bypass it!

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Fuel cells have been safely extracted and loaded. No anomalies detected.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Warning! Removing the fuel cell triggered a dead man's switch! The probe's data core just self-destructed, sending out a massive energy pulse!

nodes.speaker: science_officer_kim
nodes.text: I'm in! It's... a fragment of an AI consciousness. From a science vessel, the 'Cassini'. It was studying the gate network when... it saw something. Something that looked back.

nodes.speaker: science_officer_kim
nodes.text: The encryption is too strong. I managed to pull a few corrupted fragments, but the rest is gone. It mentions... 'a city of echoes'... 'a throne of glass'... nonsense.

nodes.speaker: SYSTEM
nodes.text: You decide to leave the derelict probe alone, its secrets still locked inside.

nodes.speaker: SYSTEM
nodes.text: You successfully salvaged fuel from the probe.

nodes.speaker: SYSTEM
nodes.text: The probe was a trap, and you sprang it.

nodes.speaker: SYSTEM
nodes.text: You recovered the probe's data, uncovering a new piece of the puzzle.

nodes.speaker: SYSTEM
nodes.text: You recovered only corrupted data, and a faint touch of madness.
